name: TheAtlantic
text: "Why would the president fire a federal prosecutor just five months before an election, with no indication of wrongdoing on the prosecutor’s part, in a manner sure to ignite controversy?" @qjurecic and @benjaminwittes write: https://t.co/n0KBmssHI4

name: TheAtlantic
text:
"I do not believe that a day has gone by since I came home, more than two months ago, that my mom has not cried."

In this week’s Dear Therapist, @LoriGottlieb1 advises a reader whose mom’s mental health struggles have worsened due to the pandemic. https://t.co/6pnUbrOIb4

name: TheAtlantic
text: "We have a chance today to reimagine an old model that has fallen far behind the times. If we do it right, we might even usher in a new golden age of education," Michael D. Smith writes: https://t.co/fuF0bhnFF2

name: TheAtlantic
text: Ricardo Sanchez, the former commander of U.S. ground forces in Iraq, has a lot to say about the "overtly racist comments and discriminatory actions of our current president." David Freed reports: https://t.co/T1PGW0R3Re

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Sociopolitics drew the usage of the word racism beyond the dictionary definition long ago, and it is high time our dictionaries got the message," @JohnHMcWhorter writes: https://t.co/yvcRV0tZbN

name: TheAtlantic
text: "Just as the arc of history bends, so too do human lives, particularly for the millions of young people expecting to launch into new careers—and adulthood—this spring and summer." @shadihamid writes: https://t.co/ySjjO47o2G

name: TheAtlantic
text: Bruce Lee’s mythology is such that pop culture’s interpretations of him have overtaken the man himself, @dannychau writes: https://t.co/NNsEoqiqF1

name: TheAtlantic
text: Photographers across Africa, the Middle East, and Asia captured the celestial phenomenon and many of its observers. Via @TheAtlPhoto: https://t.co/Fk9dt0tO3s

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @beccarosen: The brilliant @TahirDuckett on what it costs, in constitutional terms, to maintain America's criminal-justice system https://t.co/0UMCNvNpjT

name: TheAtlantic
text: "In practice, if Americans are going to mask up, public-health officials will have to cajole, not compel," @JuliaLMarcus writes: https://t.co/fkwFNDPYbT

name: TheAtlantic
text: The coronavirus outbreak has emboldened defenders of the nation-state, in Europe and beyond, @RachelDonadio writes: https://t.co/VLTzH3Oel5

name: TheAtlantic
text: RT @anneapplebaum: "The Trump White House sounds, in [John] Bolton’s telling, like a collection of soulless incompetents, perhaps graced by the presence of an exceedingly rare competent such as Bolton himself (also soulless)." @gcaw reviews Bolton's memoir: https://t.co/IvjV56NZEV

name: TheAtlantic
text: In August 1870, Emily Dickinson was nearly 40 and more comfortable in her skin than in previous years. @MarthaAckmann writes about a rare, face-to-face encounter that revealed a different side to the reclusive poet: https://t.co/1Qt1EYad5Y

name: TheAtlantic
text: The "bronies," adult fans of the children's TV show "My Little Pony," have tacitly allowed white supremacists into their ranks for years. But following Black Lives Matter protests, they're finally waking up, @kait_tiffany reports: https://t.co/puHBSJ5Q74

name: TheAtlantic
text: "The scale of America’s carceral system requires weakening constitutional protections in order to function. The resulting direct costs and collateral disadvantages are experienced almost entirely by communities of color," @TahirDuckett writes: https://t.co/vB9YQmpuAl
